channel.title: Eh.. guys, I need some help

item.title: Eh.. guys, I need some help
item.dc:creator: @Scar Scar
item.description:
@Scar wrote:

put this in your Runserver.bat file

@echo off COLOR 08 title BLAKESCAPE Client "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin\java.exe" server pause

then doubleclick on Runserver.bat and you should see : p16 enabled (or something)
after that open up a client and log in but WITHOUT pressing on Compile.bat

"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin\java.exe" server

the first code means its compiling the files.
the second one means its running so basically when you start Runserver.bat it compiles + it starts the server so you dont need to press on Compile.bat anymore

Read full topic
item.source: Eh.. guys, I need some help

item.title: Eh.. guys, I need some help
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Okay… Well, I’ve tried on two computers, because the first one was hooked up to a router and it kept telling me that the port was already in use.
but it does it on this computer too.
I do everything, i open compile, then it says “p16 by wolf enabled!”
but then i open runserver and it says “Error: Unable to startup listener on 43594 - port already in use?”
So then i close them both out, and i open runserver first, then it goes “p16 by wolf enabled!”, then i open compile, and it has the port problem again…
what should i do?
its so frustrating -.-
is there like… some other compile/run code i need to put in there? cause i put in:

@echo off
COLOR 08
title BLAKESCAPE Client
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin\java.exe” server
pause-ga-bin.jar server

for both runserver and compile…

Read full topic
item.source: Eh.. guys, I need some help
